data.title: Wrong AnimFirstFrame in AnimSpriteRenderer depending on the frame count

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

If the AnimFrameCount is one or more, the AnimFirstFrame is normal.

However, if it's equal to zero, then everything is offset by one : 
AnimFirstFrame               : 0 1 2 3 ...
Actual` index in spritesheet : 0 0 1 2 ...

data.title: Tileset Editor and Tile Palette don't render with the good filter

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Tileset Editor and Tile Palette seem to always render using the linear filter, instead of the texture's filter.

data.title: "Cannot access a disposed object", Object name : 'LogEntryList'

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

After entering SandBox mode, the log view spams continuously this error : http://pastebin.com/ZfiFy9L3

### How to reproduce

I think it happened after Duality crashed because of a newly added buggy component, which was removed after restarting Duality. I haven't been able to reproduce it.

### Workaround

Restarting Duality removed the problem.

data.title: Autotile system provides incorrect fallbacks for 16 part tilesets

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

I've run into issues when used a simpler 16 part tileset. These tilesets do not contain tiles with corner specific connectivity For example in the following tilemap (where x means tile and o means empty - a tile from a different autotile set), both tiles should fallback to the no-connection one. Note, that this example works as expected in Duality, but there are problems with some more convoluted cases.
```
o o o o
o x o o
o o x o
o o o o
```
### How to reproduce [Bugs]
1. Create a 16 part tileset. Use this image, if you don't have better. It has a transparent row below.
![tileset](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12499658/21072967/9781ae0e-bed3-11e6-8553-987313407bce.png)
2. Configure the autotiling:
![c](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12499658/21072976/080514ea-bed4-11e6-9dd3-afaec03ad62d.PNG)
3. Create the following 3x3 Tilemap:
```
x x o
x x x
x x o
```
The fallbacks are calculated incorrectly, thus the look of the tilemap is the following:
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12499658/21072988/512ef0f0-bed4-11e6-9ecc-e1137e87b64f.PNG)


### Workaround [Bugs]
Double up the image file behind the tileset, and configure all 8-connection tiles on it.

data.title: Changes in Time.cs according to issue #448
data.body: Changes in Time.cs according to issue #448

data.title: Adjust the Time Class to Favor per-Second Metrics Over per-Frame Metrics

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

An object moves "100 units per frame" is harder to grasp than "100 units per second", yet the reliance on `Time.TimeMult` reinforces per-frame metrics. To encourage users to do per-second metrics, make per-second calculations "first class citizens" in [`Time` API](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/2f648f4874b8b3f82aff059324ab5e3382c62500/Source/Core/Duality/Time.cs).

### Analysis

- Remove `LastDelta`.
- Add a new `DeltaTime` instead that provides the time-scaled number of seconds that passed since last frame as a float. It can be a shorthand for `timeMult * SPFMult` internally.
- Rename `FPSMult`, `MsPFMult` and `SPFMult` to something more reasonable, even if it ends up being more verbose. With the new `DeltaTime` property, they're usually not needed anyway, and if they are it should be clear what they stand for.
  - New names could be "FramesPerSecond", "MillisecondsPerFrame" and "SecondsPerFrame".

data.title: Introduce an "Edit Shape" Tool to the RigidBody Editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The RigidBody Editor currently provides no way of editing already-created shapes. This would be a really useful addition with a big usability increase.

### Analysis

Quote from the original issue #54:

> As soon as non-convex polygons with N vertices are supported, it would make a lot more sense to have a nice vertex editor. Maybe there could be a shared "edit shape" tool that would allow to:
> - Resize (using radius "vertex") and move (using center "vertex") circles.
> - Move vertices of a poly-like shape. 
> - Dynamically add vertices to a poly-like shape by dragging a point on the outline where currently no vertex exists.
> - Deleting vertices from a poly-like shape.
> - Make sure that it's possible to see the generated individual convex shapes, so it becomes apparent to the user that arbitrarily complex shapes are not "free". Maybe somehow visualize a "less is better" relation for vertex and fixture count?
> - Multi-selection might not be required, or at least should be carefully evaluated for its cost / benefit ratio. My guess would be it's not actually that useful in this case.
> - _Implementation note:_ Vertex editing should not be implemented using the SelObj / ObjectEditor API, since that would (a) bring more overhead than usefulness and (b) merge vertex editing with shape editing. 
>   - Instead, do a lightweight implementation in a separate RigidBodyEditorTool.
>   - This may require extending and modifying how RigidBodyEditorTools work, specifically allowing multiple begin / end cycles without deselecting.
>
> As a soft prerequisite, there probably should be a base ShapeInfo API / class for the various ShapeInfos (Poly, Loop, Chain) to reduce the amount of type checking code and keep it more extensible. This would also allow to simplify some RigidBodyShapeCamViewLayer rendering, RigidBodyRenderer and RigidBodyEditor code a lot.

- This issue still requires some concept work.
- Requirement: Issue #446 
- Could benefit from issue #331, but that would mean moving this to v3.0
- Could also benefit from a previous refactoring / cleanup of the RigidBody editor where needed.

### Attachments

- Related: Issue #54

data.title: Allow Non-Convex, Arbitrary-Sized Polygon Shapes in RigidBodies

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

RigidBody polygons are currently limited to a maximum of eight vertices and convex polygons only. Remove this limitation.

### Analysis

- The implementation of `PolyShapeInfo` accepts a `Vector2[]` and is otherwise opaque to the outside. It could very well transform this polygon into an internal representation.
- The polygon shape could internally generate multiple fixtures to represent a single non-convex polygon. (Make sure to serialize it and only re-generate on changed source shapes!)
- On the Farseer side, each generated `Fixture` could be tagged with the same shape, making the distinction invisible.
- Provide API to retrieve the internal set of convex polygons that represents the shape when needed. This will be useful for the `RigidBodyRenderer`.
- As far as size limitations go, investigate whether the eight-vertex limit is really an issue for Farseer and remove it without replacement if it isn't.
- Test RigidBody behavior thoroughly after these changes.
- Update the RigidBody Editor to reflect the above changes.

### Attachments

- Related: issue #54

data.title: Introduce a way to load the last open scene in the editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
At the moment the editor doesn't open any scene after you launched it. 
It would be nice, if you could toggle an option, so the editor loads the last open scene automatically .

The toggleable option have to be stored in the AppData (default UserData).
(see [here](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/13#issuecomment-137739542))

Some thoughts from the community:
> [22:20] SirePi: maybe a question, after you open "do you want to load the last edited scene?"
> [22:21] loeller: I think a popup is rather annoying
> [22:22] loeller: but most of the times you want to continue with the one you worked previously
> [22:23] loeller: actually, it can be a toggleable setting. But the popup at the start is not elegant imo

What do u think?

data.title: Support Project Templating Via Packages

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

While the existing package management solution works great for plugins and samples, there is currently no easy way to quickly set up a project of a certain kind by installing a set of packages. Packages are considered atomic and read-only - something else is required for quick project setup.

### Workaround

- It is always possible to install sample packages and manually integrate their source code, and write a `SerializeErrorHandler` that will fix resource issues due to switching namespaces.
- This is tedious work though, which defies the idea of a quick setup.

### Analysis

- The ultimate goal of this feature would be allowing users to quickly set up platformers, shooters or similar from sample projects, or pull in the particle system or camera handling sample just for their source code, deleting stuff that isn't necessary and quickly adjusting the rest.
- This could be solved by either introducing a new package type (`Template` packages) with special behavior.
- A likely better / more flexible solution would be to instead offer an alternative "integration" install mode that can be applied to any installed package.
- Integration mode will do the following:
  - Included project files will be examined and deconstructed. 
    - All included files will be copied over to a subfolder of the existing game plugin source folder, and they will be included in the existing game plugin project instead.
    - Will have to distinguish between core and editor plugins. Default to editor, treat core as a more restrictive special case.
    - All dependencies need to be integrated with the existing game plugin dependencies.
  - The default namespace of source files (as found in the project file) will be changed to match a sub-namespace of the game plugins main namespace.
  - A `SerializeErrorHandler` implementation will be auto-generated to resolve any renaming issues that arise from this.
  - Included data / resources can remain as-is.
  - Included plugins and binaries can remain as-is.
    - Exception: The plugin binaries that would have been generated from the included source. Those need to be filtered out.
  - The game plugin will have to be recompiled.
  - The installed package will not be added to the package configuration file and its folder in the local repository will be deleted by the updater after integration.
- All of the above can be done by the updater using new or updated `ApplyUpdate.xml` commands.
- Integration mode will be available in the package manager dialog as a dropdown of the install button for any package that is tagged as `Sample`.
- Further investigation and concept work is likely required for this issue.

data.title: Better management of UserData changes

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: This change in NativeWindow.OnUserDataChanged performs a check to verify if there is really the need to update/recreate the window, based on its current and the new settings, and allows to switch the mouse cursor visibility at runtime.

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "Logging"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

Write a wiki article that deals with how to use Duality's logging and visual logging API.

### Analysis

- Basics: LogView and the various logfiles.
- Core, Editor and Game logs.
- Messages, Warnings and Errors
- Custom `Log` instances.
- Custom `ILogOutput` implementations.
- Visual logging (with screenshots!)
- Custom `VisualLogEntry` implementations.

data.title: Move Tilemaps Sample to Samples Directory

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

For legacy reasons, the Tilemaps sample project is in a subfolder of its core plugin project. Move it to the Samples folder, like all the other sample projects.

### Analysis

- Move the folder to `Samples`.
- Rename `Testbed` to `Content`.
- Update `.csproj` paths and make sure it still works as a startup project.
- Change the main namespace so it's not part of the plugins hierarchy anymore and falls in line with the other samples namespaces.
- Update the `.nuspec` file and make sure the package build still works as expected and the package is all correct.
- Move the project inside the VS solution into the `Samples` solution folder.
- Remove the now unnecessary `.gitignore` patterns.

data.title: Refactor Anim/SpriteRenderer

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

Having `AnimSpriteRenderer` derive from `SpriteRenderer` is bad design from a component-based perspective and annoying when introducing a new subclass, as there always have to be two of them - one animated and one not. To fix this, get rid of `AnimSpriteRenderer` entirely and let `SpriteRenderer` expose a sprite index property.

### Analysis

- All animation functionality can be moved to a new `SpriteAnimator` component that requires a `SpriteRenderer` and sets the displayed sprite index accordingly. This is a much cleaner design the separates these features horizontally, rather than stacking them vertically.
- Smooth animation can be removed entirely, see issue #349.

data.title: Remove Post-Build Events in Duality Projects

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The current project setup relies heavily on postbuild command lines that copy plugins to the various directories they are required in. These command lines break the build on non-Windows systems, and they would be obsolete if there was a single binary output directory.

### Analysis

- Create a new `Build\Output` directory and make it the output path for all projects, except sample projects.
- Redirect each sample project's output directly into its `Content\Plugins` folder and disable copying dependencies.
- Update NightlyBuilder config.
- Update all `.nuspec` configs.
- Check whether NightlyBuilder has an up-to-date blacklist when packaging the installer `.zip` file.
- Check whether the Sandcastle documentation project needs any paths adjusted.

data.title: Fix Case Sensitivity Bugs in .csproj Files

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

As discovered by @mfep when building Duality using a unix system, there's a case sensitivity bug in one of the `.csproj` files. There might be more. Track them down and fix them.

### Analysis

- `RaycastCallback.cs` is referenced as `RayCastCallback.cs`

data.title: Remove Legacy NuGet Includes From .csproj Files

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Back when NuGet restore wasn't part of both VS and Monodevelop, the `csproj` include of a custom nuget target was required to guarantee a checkout-build-run experience. This is no longer the case and it might in fact cause problems. Remove the old include.

### Analysis

- Test-build a fresh checkout after changing this.

data.title: SpriteRenderer removes first character of text
data.body:
When you add a slash in front of the text of the textrenderer, the frist character of the string gets removed.

Example:
/hello -> /ello

data.title: Re-Introduce Camera Target Viewports

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

The target viewports for Camera rendering has been removed in the past and has yet to be re-introduced. 

### Analysis

- This would be implemented in `DrawDevice` and used by `Camera`, which exposes some higher-level config on this.
- Consider introducing both in Camera and rendering pass, where the rendering pass rect is relative to the Camera viewport rect, which is relative to the target size (screen or rendering target).
- Unlike [OpenGL viewports](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24538310/the-difference-between-glortho-and-glviewport-in-opengl), a camera viewport would merely specify a (relative) rectangular area to render to, without actually scaling any of the rendered contents. Matrix specs / target size will need to be adjusted accordingly.
- Automatically scaling rendered contents to a different resolution is a different issue, see #151

data.title: Turn "Steering" Into a Sample Project

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The Steering plugin is not as generic and re-usable as it could be and it behaves more like a demonstration than a polished product. It's also not that code-heavy. In its current state, it would be better off being a 100% full source included sample project for users to adjust and adapt.

### Analysis

- Make sure to update the package config / nuspec on this.
- This involves renaming the package. Make sure to unlist the old packages on NuGet.
- Move the project into the Samples directory to maintain project structure.
- ~~Document and cleanup as much as possible in the source code.~~

data.title: Turn "DynamicLighting" Into a Sample Project

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The DynamicLighting plugin is not as generic and re-usable as it could be and it behaves more like a demonstration than a polished product. It's also not that code-heavy. In its current state, it would be better off being a 100% full source included sample project for users to adjust and adapt.

### Analysis

- This would be the first sample project to include both core and editor plugin. Test this thoroughly!
- Make sure to update the package config / nuspec on this.
- This involves renaming the package. Make sure to unlist the old packages on NuGet.
- Move the project into the Samples directory to maintain project structure.
- ~~Document and cleanup as much as possible in the source code.~~

data.title: Parse math expression in textboxes

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I would find it useful if you could perform calculation in text-fields in the editor.

**For example:**
You want to center an image on the x-coordinate:  
Just type in the textbox "423/2" and the result (211,5) gets stored in the property.

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "Profiling"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

Write a wiki article that deals with how to use the Duality profiling facilities.

### Analysis

- Basics: VSync and Frame Limiting
- How to run a game in "profile mode"
- `perflog.txt`
- `ProfileRenderer`
- `Profiler` API and custom samples
- Visual Studio profiler for more fine-grained things.

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "Keyboard, Mouse, Gamepad and Joystick Input"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

As part of the [push for better documentation](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/7), write an article that explains all the available input methods and provides a bit of sample code for their most important functionality.
### Analysis
- Keyboard, Mouse, Gamepad, Joystick input API and usage
- Change of state queries, such as KeyHit vs. current state queries such as KeyDown
- Distinction between input sources and state managers.
- Custom input sources.

data.title: Object Inspector Undo / Redo Support for Adding / Removing Elements to IList and IDictionary

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

While the Object Inspector allows you to Undo / Redo modifying list and dictionary elements properly, there is currently no implementation for Undo / Redo support on adding and removing elements.
### Analysis
- There is no Add / Remove element event handler in list and dictionary property editors. This would be a required change in `AdamsLair.WinForms`.
- There is no Undo / Redo action that represents this kind of operation in a generic way yet.

data.title: Interfaces will not removed from lists in the property editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
See this issue: https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/420

When you added a interface to a list and try to remove it, it's going to be null.
As soon as you start the sandbox, the interface appears again...

![](https://thumbs.gfycat.com/EssentialIndolentBlueshark-size_restricted.gif)
https://thumbs.gfycat.com/EssentialIndolentBlueshark-size_restricted.gif

data.title: Colorpick

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Implementing https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/374

It uses a global low level mouse hook to listen to mouse Move events when the color pick button is pressed, and stops listening once the Left or Right mouse button is clicked; **Left** mouse confirms the change, **Right** mouse reverts to the last value of the editor.
This click (a single one) is filtered out, so it's safe to click on buttons or other UI elements, even of other windows, without issuing the relative command.

The color can be picked everywhere on the screen, even in a multi-monitor setup.

Also fixes a (bug?) where buttons were set to Hot state whenever the IColorDataPropertyEditor was set to Focused, independently if the button was actually hovered or not.
